div.p: In the beamtime HE 2972 the electronic and magnetic properties of two functionalised derivatives of the Mn 6 SMM family deposited on Au(111) have been investigated by XAS and XMCD techniques. They were [Mn III 6 O 2 (sao) 6 (O 2 C-tp-3) 2 (EtOH) 4 ] (1) and [Mn III 6 O 2 (Et-sao ) 6 (O 2 C-tpc-3) 2 (EtOH) 4 (H 2 O) 2 ] (2) with spin-ground state 4 and 12 respectively. The surface effects of the gold surface on deposited Mn 6 derivatives have been disclosed by comparing the variable temperature and field XMCD spectra of the Mn 6 sub-monolayers with those of the relative thick films. The results show that the average Mn III spin magnetic moment of the sub-monolayers samples turns to be decreased with respect to the relative thick films in both derivatives. The main effect responsible for this result has been ascribed due to local distortions of Mn environments followed by modified Mn-Mn exchange couplings when Mn 6 clusters are deposited on the gold surface. We argue that the origin of these local distortions might be ascribed to the molecule-gold surface covalent bond interactions and/or to the lack of the isotropic interactions with all the surrounding molecules. In addition we proved that i) the tpc functionalisation of 1 and 2 does not affect the main electronic and magnetic properties of the Mn 6 magnetic core and ii) the Mn III oxidation state is preserved even after the deposition of Mn 6 1 and 2 on gold surface. The quite robust Mn 6 magnetic cores make this class of SMM suitable for the synthesis of new derivatives with different sulphur-based functionalisations which may drive the deposition of ordered arrays of Mn 6 SMM on gold surface. In addition it encourages the use of Mn III ions having large magnetic anisotropy as building blocks for SMM with enhanced anisotropy energy barriers in view of their potential application as molecular unit of data storage devices.
